the left side of square c green and the top edge of square b blue 1 with rs facing pick up and knit 17 sts from left edge of square c green 2 pick up and knit one stitch in the corner this is the point of square a yellow 3 pick up and knit 17 sts from top edge of square b blue 35 sts 4 set-up row turn the work to ws knit to the last stitch purl 1 5 work row 1 33 from pattern chart on page 3 repeat square d until row 2 is the same length as row 1 fasten_off and trim the yarn leaving an 8 / 2 cm tail do not weave in the ends the ends can be buried in the i-cord border d d d d d d d d c row 3 d d d d d d d d c row 2 b b b b b b b b a row 1 following row start with square c followed by square d repeat this row to desired height size change the feature blanket has a total of 81 squares 9 row with 9 squares in every row if you follow this format and then decide you want a larger blanket you can still add on go back to the last square worked in row 1 and work a square b work square d for subsequent squares there will be more ends to weave in but the blanket will be the desired size important note for adding squares unless you intentionally change the design the diagonal seam will always start in the bottom right corner and finish in the top left corner before you begin knitting
